data.job_description:
You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Position Purpose: Support analytic data needs for assigned business unit. Handle complex data requests and acts as a “go to” person for other Data Analysts.

Identify and prioritize recurring and ad hoc data analysis needs of the Health Plan to enable management to control medical costs and ensure delivery of quality healthcare to members
Coordinate analysis and develop initiatives with cross health plan initiatives and capabilities
Perform analysis and reporting to support the Health Plan and Corporate
Manage development efforts with technical team liaisons, including business requirements gathering and documentation, testing, delivery and user adoption, and effectively communicate deliverable expectations to the Health Plan
Analyze plan data including service and clinical trend analysis
Develop reports through various data reporting tools
Manage, mentor, and train team of analysts

Education/Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience. Master’s degree preferred. 5+ years of data analysis experience, preferably in healthcare. Previous experience as a lead in a functional area, managing cross functional teams on large scale projects or supervisory experience including hiring, training, assigning work and managing the performance of staff. Advanced SQL and Microsoft Excel skills, relational database knowledge, and various data reporting tool experience preferred. Knowledge of statistics and application of high level mathematical models in medical and pharmacy claims data preferred. Understanding of health insurance business, claims payment procedures, strategies and trends in health care government programs preferred. HEDIS and Quality analytics experience.

Our Comprehensive Benefits Package: Flexible work solutions including remote options, hybrid work schedules and dress flexibility, Competitive pay, Paid time off including holidays, Health insurance coverage for you and your dependents, 401(k) and stock purchase plans, Tuition reimbursement and best-in-class training and development.

Centene is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent experience
5+ years of data analysis experience, preferably in healthcare

Previous experience as a lead in a functional area, managing cross functional teams on large scale projects or supervisory experience including hiring, training, assigning work and managing the performance of staff
HEDIS and Quality analytics experience

data.job_description:
The world isn’t standing still, and neither is Allstate. We’re moving quickly, looking across our businesses and brands and taking bold steps to better serve customers’ evolving needs. That’s why now is an exciting time to join our team. You’ll have opportunities to take risks, challenge the status quo and shape the future for the greater good.

You’ll do all this in an environment of excellence and the highest ethical standards – a place where values such as integrity, inclusive diversity and accountability are paramount. We empower every employee to lead, drive change and give back where they work and live. Our people are our greatest strength, and we work as one team in service of our customers and communities.

Everything we do at Allstate is driven by a shared purpose: to protect people from life’s uncertainties so they can realize their hopes and dreams. For more than 89 years we’ve thrived by staying a step ahead of whatever’s coming next – to give customers peace of mind no matter what changes they face. We acted with conviction to advocate for seat belts, air bags and graduated driving laws. We help give survivors of domestic violence a voice through financial empowerment. We’ve been an industry leader in pricing sophistication, telematics, digital photo claims and, more recently, device and identity protection.

We are the Good Hands. We don’t follow the trends. We set them.

Job Summary:

The Insurance Product Management Senior Consultant is responsible for the overall financial and health of the product(s) and contributes to achieving profit and growth targets for an insurance product(s). This position will analyze and present complex data and facts to support recommendations on potential initiatives, interacting with other departments in and out of Allstate Personal Lines (APL) Product.

Key Responsibilities:

• Contribute to the achievement of short- and long-term strategies to achieve market share growth and profitability targets on a countrywide basis
• Gather relevant facts in support of strategies to ensure the integration and execution of product, pricing and risk management for countrywide usage
• Manage / perform unique work assignments and problem resolution across systems, processes or channels and navigate obstacles to deliver the work product
• Execute strategies which may include new distribution channel initiatives, best practices and new products and services
• Perform analyses (e.g. competitor, product, market, risk management, financial) to understand the underlying health of the product(s)
• Actively participate in coordinated efforts across the organization to facilitate the implementation of initiatives
• Perform activities to ensure appropriate development and implementation of products
• Measure and communicate results; make recommendations to leaders on redirection opportunities of efforts

Supervisory Responsibilities:

This job does not have supervisory duties.

Education and Experience:

• Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience
• 3+ years relevant experience

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

• None

Functional Skills:
• Advanced product, price, underwriting and insurance regulation knowledge, with working knowledge of Allstate Personal Lines’ rate plans and product offerings
• Advanced knowledge about business in general, knowledge of industry and company economics;
• Advanced problem-solving skills
• Ability to consistently achieve superior results
• Demonstrated sense of curiosity and desire to solve problems
• Demonstrated and foster a sense of urgency, strong commitment and accountability for achieving results
• Ability to understand business tactics to support changing business strategies and direction
• Collaborates to implement decisions and / or initiatives in an integrated manner
• Proven ability to effectively network and communicate with different types and levels of staff, both written and verbal

Compensation offered for this role is $61,500.00-$105,750.00 per year and is based on experience and qualifications.

The candidate(s) offered this position will be required to submit to a background investigation, which includes a drug screen.

Good Work. Good Life. Good Hands®.

As a Fortune 100 company and industry leader, we provide a competitive salary – but that’s just the beginning. Our Total Rewards package also offers benefits like tuition assistance, medical and dental insurance, as well as a robust pension and 401(k). Plus, you’ll have access to a wide variety of programs to help you balance your work and personal life -- including a generous paid time off policy. For a full description of Allstate’s benefits, visit allstate.jobs/benefits/

Learn more about life at Allstate. Connect with us on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and LinkedIn or watch a video.

Allstate generally does not sponsor individuals for employment-based visas for this position.

data.job_description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

As a Data Analyst in our team, you will be responsible for all data related elements, including query building, developing data models, managing/creating KPIs and building impactful data visualizations. You will also have the opportunity to interact with businesses across different domains and to collaborate with multiple technical engineering teams.

About Team: Enterprise Business Services – Data Intelligence
Do you dream about data? Can you see patterns and answers in the data when others see just a bunch of numbers? Then, this role is for you! As a painter that uses raw colors to create a masterpiece, you will be the artist using raw, massive, and complex data sets to tell stories and create visualizations to uncover patterns, trends, and insights.

As part of the Enterprise Business Services – Data Intelligence team, you will be designing and developing analytical solutions with actionable insights across multiple areas and domains, helping the business in their analytical journey, unlocking savings, and supporting leadership in making better and faster decisions.

What you’ll do:
• Develop metrics, storyboards, and dashboards by gathering data from various sources to tell a story about the data.
• Analyze complex data to identify patterns, detect anomalies in data using statistical concepts and tools.
• Use knowledge in Data Discovery tools to write queries and analyze data to identify patterns, trends, outliers, and correlations.
• Bring new ideas for data visualizations and analytics.
• Interact and work with multiple cross-functional teams.

What you’ll bring:
• Hands-on experience in Visualization Tools like Power BI, Tableau, Looker, QlikView, SAP Lumira, MicroStrategy, etc.
• Develops and understand Data Model and define complex relationship within the tables.
• Demonstrates expertise in writing queries across large data sets.
• Expertise with RDBMS (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL) with an excellent understanding of transaction management and performance tuning.
• Understanding of descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics.
• Experience in scripting languages, such as, Python or R.
• Understand the conception of process mining, thru utilizing log data to build the process model.
• Ability on identifying process insights, gaps, and ROI opportunities.
• Be able to wireframe and mockup potential data visualization solutions to address the business requirements.
• Experience on working with Agile methodology - Kanban or SCRUM.
• Ability to work through ambiguity and drive for clarity of direction.
• Have previous experience in Celonis and being able to build basic PQL queries and PU-functions a plus.
• Have previous experience in Celonis, Celonis Studio, and Celonis Analysis visualizations and custom KPIs a plus.
• Develop interactive visualizations across multiple analyses with interactive, dynamic drilldown charts and OLAP tables with dynamic dimensions using user variables in Celonis a plus.

.
About Walmart Global Tech
Imagine working in an environment where one line of code can make life easier for hundreds of millions of people. That’s what we do at Walmart Global Tech. We’re a team of software engineers, data scientists, cybersecurity expert's and service professionals within the world’s leading retailer who make an epic impact and are at the forefront of the next retail disruption. People are why we innovate, and people power our innovations. We are people-led and tech-empowered. We train our team in the skillsets of the future and bring in experts like you to help us grow. We have roles for those chasing their first opportunity as well as those looking for the opportunity that will define their career. Here, you can kickstart a great career in tech, gain new skills and experience for virtually every industry, or leverage your expertise to innovate at scale, impact millions and reimagine the future of retail.

Flexible, hybrid work:
We use a hybrid way of working that is primarily in office coupled with virtual when not onsite. Our campuses serve as a hub to enhance collaboration, bring us together for purpose and deliver on business needs. This approach helps us make quicker decisions, remove location barriers across our global team and be more flexible in our personal lives.

Benefits:
Benefits: Beyond our great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Equal Opportunity Employer:
Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 1 year's
experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: 3 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)

Responsibilities

We are looking for a Data Analyst insupport of our Defense Agency customer.

We provide Department of Defense data to Federal and State agencies, Congress and researchers.

The analyst needs to understand data exceptionally well to make sure we provide the correct information to our users. This includes understanding their requirements along with being able to technically provide the correct data. We are primairly using ANSI SQL in an AWS Cloud environment.

Must be U.S. Citizen and must have active/current DoD Public Trust Designation, Secret preferred

This is NOT a database administrator role. This is a hands-on Data Analyst.

What you will do:
• SQL skills along with the ability to convert legacy reports to SQL
• Analyzing current output and legacy code (often in SAS) to reverse engineer the logic needed to produce the report.
• Strong data analysis skills to quickly understand the reports and how to validate the logic
• Exceptional investigative and documentation skills

Qualifications
• BS 0-2 Years or HS 6-8
• Write complex SQL queries while also knowing how to create maintainable code.
• Strong communication skills (verbal/written) to deliver the technical insights and interpret the data reports to the clients.
• Able to comprehend and translate complex and advanced functional, technical and business requirements into executable architectural designs.
• Creating and maintaining technical documentation.
• Demonstrated experience analyzing and managing requirements and demonstrated strong analytical and problem solving skills.
• Experience working in and with MS Office tools.
• U.S. Citizenship and the ability to obtain a DoD position of Public Trust clearance (required to start)

Desired Experiences:
• Department of Defense data knowledge or experience.
• Ability to organize material and complete writing assignment according to established standards regarding clarity, conciseness, style and terminology.
• Data bricks or AWS S3 experience
• QLIK experience
• Python
• Certification: Security+CE preferred
Benefits: At Peraton, our benefits are designed to help keep you at your best, beyond the work you do with us daily. We are fully committed to the growth of our employees. From fully comprehensive medical plans, to tuition reimbursement, tuition assistance, and fertility treatment, we are there to support you all the way.

Peraton Overview

Peraton drives missions of consequence spanning the globe and extending to the farthest reaches of the galaxy. As the world's leading mission capability integrator and transformative enterprise IT provider, we deliver trusted and highly differentiated national security solutions and technologies that keep people safe and secure. Peraton serves as a valued partner to essential government agencies across the intelligence, space, cyber, defense, civilian, health, and state and local markets. Every day, our employees do the can't be done, solving the most daunting challenges facing our customers.

Target Salary Range

$51,000 - $82,000. This represents the typical salary range for this position based on experience and other factors.

EEO Tagline (Text Only)

An Equal Opportunity Employer including Disability/Veteran.

Experience working in and with MS Office tools

data.job_description:
About the role:

DUAL North America, Inc. is seeking a passionate Data Analyst to join our team and support our data-driven decision-making process. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements and help coordinate projects within the team.

Essential Functions:

· Collect and analyze large datasets, using statistical methods to identify trends and patterns to find usable information.

· Develop and maintain data dashboards and visualizations to communicate insights and trends to stakeholders.

· Work closely with other teams, such as marketing, product, and engineering, to identify and prioritize data-driven insights and requirements.

· Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support business decision-making.

· Ensure data accuracy, completeness, and consistency by implementing and maintaining data governance policies and procedures.

· Ensure the integrity and accuracy of data.

· Stay up to date with emerging data analytics technologies and trends and recommend appropriate solutions to the organization.

· Work with executives and other business leaders to identify opportunities for improvement.

· Create reports for internal teams and/or external clients

· Establish KPIs to measure the effectiveness of business decisions

· Work with a team of analysts and other associates to process information

· Create presentations and reports based on recommendations and findings

· Assist in the planning a coordination of data and BI projects.

Job Requirements (education, experience, skills):

· Bachelor's or Master's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.

· At least 2 years of experience in data analysis or business intelligence.

· Strong knowledge of SQL, and experience working with relational databases.

· Experience with data visualization tools such as PowerBI or Tableau.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

· Familiarity with statistical analysis tools such as R or Python.

· Experience with data governance policies and procedures.

· Familiarity with emerging data analytics technologies and trends.
• Analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Ability to set and meet deadlines.

· Experience with industry Project Management tools such as Jira or equivalent

· Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to manage multiple concurrent projects.

· Insurance related experience is a plus

· If you do not meet all the qualifications for this role, we still encourage you to apply, as we are always looking for diverse talent to join our growing team.

What we offer:

A career that you define. Yes, we offer all the usual rewards and benefits - including medical, dental, vision, a wide variety of wellbeing offers, competitive salary, unlimited PTO, 401k with company match, paid volunteer days and more.

We provide an environment where new ideas are encouraged and celebrated, where people who want to have a real hand in our success thrive. We want people who want to make a difference - not just in the workplace, but in the industry and in the wider community.

About DUAL NA:

DUAL is the leading underwriting organization in the US and part of an international insurance organization with operations in 45 countries across the world. DUAL offers commercial property, casualty, financial lines, and personal property insurance products underwritten through several specialized subsidiaries. Since 2013, we have grown to over 500 employees in 14 offices across the US, and we are continuing to grow. DUAL is committed to building a balanced business and contributing to a sustainable world. At DUAL, we believe our people are our greatest assets, espousing entrepreneurialism, and innovation in an environment where new insights are encouraged.

Our culture: People First

Our core values dictate how we live and work. We are a group with independence and people at its heart and we are a home for talent with a unique culture: the biggest small company in the world.

The focus on being a People First business has always been at the very heart of the Group; Our vision was to create an independent business with a unique culture and one that would survive and thrive as a business controlled by the people working for it. And finding the most talented and entrepreneurial people to join the Group has been and will continue to be key.

EEO Statement:

We consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness, and respect. DUAL North America provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training. DUAL will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.

data.job_description:
Company Description

At Nearpod, we believe teaching is the most important job in the world. Every day, we reach students through our learning platforms on Nearpod.com and Flocabulary.com. We have diverse backgrounds, but a shared goal of putting teachers and students first in everything that we do. We have won numerous awards including EdTech Digest’s 2018 Company of the Year. Recently, we were acquired by Renaissance to support the shared mission of accelerating learning for all. We’re looking for people with a lot of hustle, a lot of empathy, and a desire to do something meaningful. We've adopted a remote-first culture, and our diverse team is based across the US.

Job Description

Position Overview:

We are seeking a skilled Salesforce Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for extracting and manipulating Salesforce data to support reporting, data validation, and mass data updates. You will also be responsible for collaborating with developers on the data-related aspects of their work, such as initializing new fields. The successful candidate should have strong SOQL and SQL skills and be comfortable working with tools such as Knime, Alteryx, Pentaho, or equivalent.

Our Ideal Candidate Will:
• Extract, manipulate, and analyze large sets of Salesforce data to support reporting, data validation, and mass data updates.
• Work closely with the Data Warehouse team to help support their Salesforce Data needs.
• Collaborate with developers on the data-related aspects of their work, such as initializing new fields.
• Review and support data requests pertaining to accuracy or analysis.
• Develop and maintain data processes that ensure data accuracy, completeness, and integrity across systems.
• Develop and implement data quality rules, monitoring, and reporting.
• Ensure that data is compliant with data governance policies and procedures.
• Create and maintain documentation for data extraction, manipulation, and analysis processes.

Qualifications

Required Skills & Experience:
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
• 2+ years of experience working with Salesforce data.
• Strong SOQL and SQL skills.
• Comfortable using ETL tools such as Knime, Alteryx, Pentaho, or equivalent to work with large sets of data.
• Experience with Tableau is a plus.
• Salesforce Administrator skills are a nice to have.
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Additional Information

Salary range: min: $82,200 mid: $102,800, max: $123,400

Employment Requirements: Must be authorized to work in the U.S. without restrictions

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Benefits:

data.job_description:
Humble Bundle sells games, ebooks, software, and other digital content. Our mission is to support charity while providing awesome content to customers at great prices. We launched in 2010 with a single two-week Humble Indie Bundle, but we have humbly grown into a store full of games and bundles, a subscription service, a game publisher, and more. We have raised $200 million for charity and counting.

Humble Games is Humble Bundle’s game publishing arm. Humble Games is the result of a shared passion to support indie developers, deliver top-quality content to gamers around the world and continue the Humble mission to be a force for good in the industry and across the globe.

Position Intro:

The Analytics team at Humble Bundle is growing and establishing themselves as trusted leaders in translating data into insights. We are looking for an experienced and proactive data analyst who can provide quantitative analysis, market expertise, and a strategic perspective in order to drive value for our growing publishing business. You will turn business questions into data analysis and then effectively communicate meaningful recommendations on strategy. You will have become familiar with our entire data pipeline - from how data is ingested from raw data sources to how it undergoes transformations into a usable format to applying statistical methods to distill relevant information.

Responsibilities:
• Conduct data analysis to provide actionable insights for our video game titles
• Create forecasting models for all stages of video game lifecycle from pre-launch to new release to catalog status
• Segment products with different sales curves to improve model performance
• Help define and measure Humble Games KPIs and growth goals
• Stay up to date with competitive market data and apply insights to internal products to predict sales trends
• Deliver effective presentations of findings and recommendations to key stakeholders
• Develop reports and dashboards in Tableau and Google Data Studio that can support dynamic and efficient reporting
• Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders and liaise with Product, Marketing, and Business Development to understand their business needs on all publishing data related matters

Required Experience:
• 1-3 years experience in analytics role

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
• SQL
• Excel
• Visualization tool like Tableau or Google Data Studio

Education:
• Bachelors in quantitative / analytical field

Bonus Points
• Passion for video games is a plus!

Covid-19 Hiring Update: We’ve transitioned to a work-from-home model and we’re continuing to interview and hire during this time. This is a remote position with a strong preference for candidates who can work in the Pacific time zone.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Consultant, Business Analysis

About Our Firm:

Granite Solutions Groupe provides financial services decision makers with people and solutions that deliver. Our clients count on us to deliver the right talent at the right time to achieve critical business results. We leverage our industry knowledge and passion for client priorities to deliver human capital solutions.

GSG was founded in 1998 as a consulting firm delivering project management and technology solutions for the financial services industry. GSG now has a global presence, with team members deployed across the U.S. at Fortune 1000 companies and high-performing Fintech firms.

High-caliber consultants are the face of GSG at our client organizations and offices. We value the deep relationships we have with our consultants that enable us to place them in roles where their skills will have an immediate impact. The GSG consulting team is comprised of diverse, experienced, driven, and dynamic contributors who excel at getting things done.

About the Opportunity:

GSG is seeking an experienced Middle Office Business Analyst/Data Analyst for our client in the financial services.

Responsibilities:
• Work with middle office and controllers professionals to understand and produce business and functional requirements and collaborate with the development teams to implement solutions.
• Work with internal resources as well as application vendors to establish the appropriate development approach and timeline.
• Track and maintain project plans, risk matrices, issues lists, and all related project artifacts to ensure successful implementation of related engagements.
• Develop comprehensive test cases and participate in QA Testing.
• Develop end-user training materials and deliver training to a broad user base.
• Communicate effectively with stakeholders and build relationships on a continuous basis.
• Collaborate with teams to identify root cause.
• Assist with the analysis of middle office platform processes and capabilities and the ongoing development of a technology strategy.
• Partner with the business to ensure SLAs and other key metrics are met or exceeded.
• Identify best practices for optimizing system use both internally and externally.
• Act as an escalation point for support issues and increase in-house functional support resolution with well-documented and permanent resolutions.

Requirements:
• 8+ years industry full cycle experience of SDLC methodologies and approaches, including refining business requirements and defining functional specifications.
• Experience with Business Analysis methodologies, use case modelling, user stories, etc.
• Excellent conceptualization, analytical, and logic skills.
• Excellent communications skills, with the ability to work with business users as well as other members of the technical staff.
• Deep understanding of the middle office and controller functions (e.g. investment accounting, reconciliation, cash management, etc.).
• Experience with a leading fund accounting platform required.
• Experience working with data warehouses and business intelligence platforms.
• Technical experience with application infrastructure, including servers, DB, networking.
• Knowledge of credit instruments (Bank Loans, Bonds, Derivatives, etc.).
• Experience with SQL is preferred.
• Demonstrated ability to prioritize and to deliver multiple projects on time and within budget.
• Adept at listening and soliciting feedback middle office users and stakeholders.
• Must be self-directed and motivated while being a solid team player with a strong work ethic.
• Ability to thrive in a high intensity, faced paced environment.

Employee Benefits:

GSG is excited to offer its consultants a robust option of benefits which include comprehensive medical, dental, vision and prescription coverage. You will receive company-paid life insurance. In addition, we hope you will take advantage of eligible commuter benefits-like paying for work-related public transit and parking with pre-tax dollars. Save for your retirement with pre-tax contributions that go directly into your 401K. We also care about your pets with several options for pet insurance, discount card and prescriptions.

GSG’s Commitment to Diversity:

As a diverse-owned business, GSG is committed to creating a diverse workforce, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

data.job_description:
Overview

Aura helps customers monitor, manage, and protect against the risks associated with their identities and personal information in a digital world. With adaptive technology, a seasoned team, and a first-of-its-kind product suite, Aura enables customers to manage disparate cybersecurity needs with ease. Backed by premier investors, WndrCo and General Catalyst, Aura's category-defining business is a holistic personal digital security platform that unites best-in-class privacy, identity, and security products.

Trusted by more than 2 million customers, Aura has a team of more than 450 people worldwide and revenues over $200 million. Most importantly, this trajectory continues to show momentum and is supported by strong organic growth in addition to strategic customer acquisition. Aura’s leadership team has seen similar success before, having grown a start-up to a valuation of over $3 billion prior to exit. With a clear vision, strong alignment, and strategic M&A execution, Aura has assembled a stellar team and built a unique culture with incredible employees. Join us for the ride!

The RoleWe are looking for a Data Superstar who possesses a passion for data, metrics, and uncovering actionable insights. As a Product Data Analyst, you’ll partner with our Product, Engineering, Marketing, Design teams and other Data Analysts to help AURA build a magical consumer product solution that brings together privacy, security, and identity protection capabilities. You will be focused on behavior and feature engagement analytics to help product owners and stakeholders improve the customer experience. Our ideal candidate loves digging into the metrics and details, and is proficient in bringing to life insights through clear storytelling.

Responsibilities
• Create and maintain product health metrics and dashboards
• Investigate data issues and escalate them to the relevant group when needed
• Provide tracking requirements for mobile, desktop and web applications
• Develop compelling dashboards to measure the impact of new product features or business initiatives
• Perform an ad-hoc analysis while working closely with Product Owners helping them to understand the data and make decisions
• Interact with multiple teams to better understand structure, meaning and source of data
• Provide quarterly analysis on key product features usage and trends, to identify insights and areas of improvement for product

Qualifications
• BA/BS degree, 5+ years of experience as a data analyst
• Proficient with SQL, comfortable working with large datasets and multiple data sources
• Ability to write SQL for both ad-hoc analyses and scheduled ETL
• Experienced with Tableau visualization and storytelling
• A team player and self-starter with great interpersonal skills and a solution-oriented attitude
• Great at distilling data into actionable insights and recommendations
• Manipulate, transform, and analyze complex, high-volume, high-dimensional data
• Experience and passion for developing the right metrics and dashboards/visualizations
• Ability to work cross-functionally with stakeholders from across the business

Nice to Have
• Previous experience with product analytics
• Cross-platform applications analytics
• Working in globally distributed teams

In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination or harassment based on “protected categories,” Aura is committed to being an inclusive community where all feel welcome. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Aura.

Aura and its subsidiaries participate in E-Verify.

EOE M/F/D/V
Apply for this job online

data.job_description:
Description

The Data Analyst reports to the Director of Data Management and is an integral member of the Data Management Office. The Data Analyst plays a key role working with subject matter experts to ensure proper utilization of data via analysis, discovery and investigation of potential data quality issues. The Data Analyst will use his or her's skills in data analysis, data mapping, and investigation to help business units and other associates in the data management group deliver key information assets like reports, data integrations, data quality profiles, dashboards and design documents. The data analyst will work on other data related projects as directed by the Manager of the Data Management Office.

Experience with data warehouse environments is highly desirable. Experience with SQL databases and business requirements gathering and creation will be necessary for this position. The Data Analyst will work closely with other team members of the Data Management Group which includes the Data Integration team, Business Intelligence, and Data Governance/Data Quality. The Data Analyst will communicate effectively with other team members and management to deliver results in a timely fashion.

The successful candidate for this role will have 5 or more years working in a similar capacity with excellent communication skills and hands on expertise with data query tools.

Responsibilities
• Work with management to prioritize data and information needs
• Working with subject matter experts and assisting the business analyst to translate needs to business requirements with an emphasis on non-technical, business friendly terms and language.
• Interpret data, analyze results
• Develop data mappings, data flows, and data lineage artifacts.
• Develop expertise in data structures, and data elements to assist other members of the Data Management Office.
• Identify and make recommendations as to acquisition of new sources of data.
• Identify data quality issues and make recommendations to improve the overall quality of data.
• Identify and define new process improvement opportunities

Education and Experience
• BA/BS in Business, computer science, Information Management or related discipline
• Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
• 5+ Years' professional experience

Required Skills
• Strong working knowledge writing queries in structured query language (SQL). Experience with other data manipulation and data preparation techniques and technologies
• Experience with one or more of the major database platforms (Oracle, MS Sql Server, MySql)
• Familiarity and working knowledge MS Office, Visio or other diagramming tools
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate complex ideas and findings
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Good working knowledge of data mapping techniques, and writing business requirements
• Experience and exposure to project management concepts and tools
• Required non-technical skills include: written communication, interpersonal skills working in an team environment, complex problem solving, results orientated, adaptability to change, self-motivated, able to see the big picture while delivering tangible results

#remote

data.job_description:
WHO ARE WE?

Launch Potato is a digital media company with a portfolio of brands and technologies. As The Discovery and Conversion Company, Launch Potato's mission is to be the most innovative, tech-enabled media company connecting consumers to the world's leading brands.

The company is headquartered in vibrant downtown Delray Beach, Florida, with a unique international team across over a dozen countries. Launch Potato's success comes from a diverse, energetic culture and a high-performing, entrepreneurial team.

YOUR ROLE:

We need someone like you to lead efforts in transforming enterprise data into actionable insights. Reporting to the Associate Director of Analytics, you will develop a deep understanding of Launch Potato's data to support yield, user acquisition, product, remarketing, and account managers.

You will become the subject matter expert in at least one vertical, including, but not limited to, insurance, credit cards, and/or SEO. In addition, you will own reporting standardizations, content creation, and ad hoc analysis that will help identify growth opportunities.

Success in this role will directly impact your ability to earn the team's confidence by delivering insightful, accurate, and actionable data through strategic partnerships within the organization.

Success will be further determined by your ability to:

Always take into account the advertiser's CAC (Customer Acquisition Costs), page RPS (Revenue Per Session), ROAS (Return on Ad Spend), and funnel/user engagement metrics. Our partners' success directly impacts the continued growth of Launch Potato.

Develop and follow reporting standardizations within the organization.

Understand our internal data intricacies and have a significant focus on data accuracy.

Proactively seek opportunities through complex analysis by joining multiple data sets together.

Present thoughtful insights to media buyers, yield, remarketing, account management, product teams, and leadership.

Become a subject matter expert in one or more verticals within the organization.

Data Visualization & Business Intelligence:

Bring visibility and control to the stakeholders in your vertical by building and maintaining dashboards, visualizations, and reporting in our BI tool, Looker.

Develop and follow standards in how our reporting content is organized.

Become an SME on our library of Looker Explores specific to your vertical.

Help improve the quality and accessibility of necessary data points in Looker.

Write complex SQL queries between multiple tables to unleash insights not derived from pre-existing data models.

Communication & Requirement Gathering:

Develop a strategic partnership with stakeholders by translating data requests into insightful and data-driven conversations.

Drive and follow through on initiatives based on opportunities and hypotheses found in the data.

Work and proactively communicate across all parts of the organization.

Present your findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders using your strength in written and verbal communication.

Collaborate with data scientists & business intelligence teams to unlock additional insights.

Business Support:

Thrive in a collaborative team environment that focuses mainly on data.

Help design and execute A/B testing analysis based on insights presented to the team.

Ability to conduct competitor analysis within your vertical.

Develop a strong understanding of the tools and systems.

Assist in QA and debugging tasks related to anomalies found in the data.

Evaluate pricing impacts with variable payout change assumptions.

Ability to measure the impact of your analysis.

WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:

5+ years of direct experience as an analyst within a performance marketing business.

Strong focus on data validation and accuracy.

Complete complex analysis by joining multiple data sets together.

Not afraid to raise questions about data anomalies.

Strong analytical and quantitative skills to manage highly complex information.

Willingness to adapt to a fast-paced work environment.

Ability to build relationships within the organization through actionable and accurate insights.

Proficiency in a BI platform, Excel, and SQL.

Want to make your impact in a profitable, high-growth company? Apply now!

Since day one, we've been committed to having a diverse, inclusive team and culture. We are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity company. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion.

data.job_description:
**Job Description**
• *Background of the project**

The IRC responds to the world’s worst humanitarian crises and helps people whose lives and livelihoods are shattered by conflict and disaster to survive, recover, and gain control of their future. Founded in 1933 at the request of Albert Einstein, the IRC offers lifesaving care and life-changing assistance to refugees, IDPs, and others affected by war or disaster. At work today in over 40 countries and in 22 U.S. cities, the IRC restores safety, dignity and hope to millions who are uprooted and struggling to endure. We address both the immediate, life -saving needs of conflict-affected people in an emergency and the reconstruction needs in post-conflict societies.

The Airbel Impact Lab, IRC’s hub for research and innovation, supports the various technical units across the IRC to conduct or backstop research studies and innovation projects, and also leads initiatives that provide resources for country programs to design and implement programs based on evidence. We conduct this research across IRC’s outcome areas of health, economic wellbeing, safety, power, and education.

For this project, the Airbel Impact Lab (Research & Innovation at the International Rescue Committee - IRC) and Violence Prevention and Response Technical Unit is looking for a consultant to conduct analysis of a cluster randomized controlled trial. This trial evaluates the effectiveness of the Safe at Home program on changes in family functioning, child abuse, and intimate partner violence. Secondary analyses goals are to understand the pathways through which potential changes have occurred. Analyses would be conducted for both intent-to-treat and per protocol approaches across ~200 couples, in which data are available for both men’s and women’s reports.
• *Scope of Work:**

The consultant will be expected to:

\- Refine multilevel regression analyses to understand both intent-to-treat and per protocol changes over time on outcomes of interest, accounting for clustering at the group and site level. For violence outcomes in particular, examine changes in cessation and frequency/severity over time.
\- Examine impacts for heterogeneity of treatment effect by baseline demographics or other variables in sensitivity analyses
\- Undertake latent class analyses to examine patterns of violence within families and potential change over time
\- Explore dyadic analyses of change over time within couples
• *Deliverables:**

\- Tables for use in reports and peer-reviewed manuscripts, including the above outlined analyses and results
\- All coding logs and outputs
• *Qualifications**
• *Payment Rate and Schedule:**

\- 30% after delivery of cleaned dataset and descriptive statistics
\- 70% at the end of the contract
• *Requirements:**

\- Highly proficient with demonstrated experience in analyzing trial or longitudinal clustered data
\- Expertise in violence prevention research, and in particular, familiarity with constructs and standard coding of outcomes
\- Attention to detail
\- Postdoctoral level preferred, but doctoral level statistical training possible based on years of experience

Qualifications: \- Highly proficient with demonstrated experience in analyzing trial or longitudinal clustered data
\- Expertise in violence prevention research, and in particular, familiarity with constructs and standard coding of outcomes
Responsibilities: This trial evaluates the effectiveness of the Safe at Home program on changes in family functioning, child abuse, and intimate partner violence
\- Refine multilevel regression analyses to understand both intent-to-treat and per protocol changes over time on outcomes of interest, accounting for clustering at the group and site level
For violence outcomes in particular, examine changes in cessation and frequency/severity over time
\- Examine impacts for heterogeneity of treatment effect by baseline demographics or other variables in sensitivity analyses
\- Undertake latent class analyses to examine patterns of violence within families and potential change over time
\- Explore dyadic analyses of change over time within couples
*Deliverables:**
\- Tables for use in reports and peer-reviewed manuscripts, including the above outlined analyses and results

Position Summary...

What you'll do...

Director of Global Audit Assurance Analytics
Walmart Corporate – Job R-1444470
Bentonville, AR (In-Office)

Director of Global Audit Assurance Analytics Job for the Fortune#1 Global Technology Audit and Operations Team

About Walmart Global Technology Audit

Walmart Global Audit is committed to protecting our company, while remaining independent and objective in our approach and frame of mind. We work with management to prioritize and mitigate risk and serve as remediation stewards that ensure sustainable solutions. We offer a supportive environment to expand your skills and develop your career within the dynamic Fortune#1 culture.

Walmart's Global Technology Audit Team is hiring a Director of Global Audit Assurance Data Analytics to support data strategy and technology innovations for our Global Audit team across Walmart’s massive worldwide business footprint. Reporting to the Vice President of Global Technology Audit, you'll serve as an important manager to advise on risk and ensure data integrity presented by auditors to our global partners. You will work with both Data Analysts and Internal Auditors to refine data sets that will best support our auditors and their audit plans. You will rely on your strategic data analytics experience with Audit or Enterprise Risk, data visualization, ability to implement new tools and workflows, and insights to support Walmart's Global Audit Team.

What you'll do:

• Advise Global Audit Data Analysts and Audit Team Members by providing a forward-looking lens for delivering sound data supporting our audit plans and priorities

• Assist Senior Leadership with a structured approach to grow a digital audit practice by using data analytics and automation

• Assure Data Integrity by facilitating collaboration between data analysts, global auditors and LOB partners to provide a path to better solutions

• Promote Long-term Value by creating continuous assurance models and strengthening relationships with internal and external partners

• Teach the Audit Department with periodic trainings for the greater audit team to develop and implement enhanced data analytics techniques and test procedures

• Develop Talent and Leadership to attract and build an accomplished workforce, while promoting a positive environment for team members to grow

What you'll bring:
• You have 7+ years of data analytics or technology-related experience in Internal or Operational Audit, Risk Analysis, Compliance, or Enterprise Risk Management within a large corporate environment.
• You have experience developing assurance programs or process models that use varied sources of data within large organizations.
• You have experience building teams of data analysts or data scientists and have developed data analytics programs to support assurance of high-quality audits.
• You manage process improvement and the standardization of data sets for risk, audit, or controls-related teams.
• You have experience in big data analytics, techniques for automation and methods to analyze business problems, and developing questions and assumptions to help departments identify anomalies and root causes.
• You are experienced in categories of data, data requirements, database technologies and stores, data quality best practices for understanding data, and the identification of the most suitable source of data for a given purpose.
• You have technical expertise in both data visualization and coding with SQL, PowerBI, Big Query, Tableau, DataIku, or similar platforms.
• You have experience working with ERP and non-ERP data sources such as SAP, Oracle, GCP, and DB2.
• You have experience evaluating new technology and its implementation.
• You excel at presenting plans and new ideas to business partners and senior-level management.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

About Finance

A career in finance at Walmart offers endless opportunities to make a difference on a global scale. As the world's largest retailer, Walmart relies on its finance team to provide insights and guidance on everything from new product launches to operations in emerging markets.

If you're looking for a challenge, there's no shortage of opportunities here. You'll use your analytical skills to evaluate new products, identify risks, and develop financial models. You'll also have the chance to work on projects to help Walmart continue to grow.

No matter what role you play on the finance team, you'll make a difference in the lives of millions of people around the world.

Benefits & Perks

Beyond a great compensation package, you can receive incentive awards for your performance. Other great perks include 401(k) match, stock purchase plan, paid maternity and parental leave, PTO, multiple health plans, and much more.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer – By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our team members, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity - unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions – while being inclusive of all people.

OVERVIEW:

INTECON, LLC is seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst II to join its team in support of the FEMA Office of National Continuity Programs (ONCP) Business Management Division (BMD) . The selected candidate will be responsible for providing critical support to the BMD's five major areas of responsibility, including Budget and Financial Management, Acquisitions Management, Human Resources Administration, Asset Management, and Portfolio Oversight.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Conduct quantitative and qualitative data analysis to support BMD operations and decision-making processes.
• Develop and maintain data systems, tools, and processes to collect, store, and analyze data related to BMD operations and performance.
• Design and conduct surveys, assessments, and evaluations to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement in BMD operations.
• Collaborate with BMD stakeholders to identify data needs and develop appropriate data solutions to support their business requirements.
• Generate reports and presentations that effectively communicate data insights and findings to BMD stakeholders.
• Develop and maintain a comprehensive understanding of BMD operations, policies, and procedures, as well as the broader context of ONCP's mission and objectives.
• Assist in developing manageable budget milestones aligning with FEMA and DHS goals. Milestones shall be aligned with DHS-wide earned value management (EVM) guidelines related to cost accounting and financial management.
• Assist in budget formulation and execution, with analysts supporting division portfolios.
• Assist in Event Tracking and Approval (ETA) and Travel Submission Management
• Aid in package review, approval, and email through Enterprise Coordination Approvals Processing System (ECAPS) tracking and approval
• Provides support for developing status of funds and briefing charts.
• Assists in preparing required OCFO quarterly and annual Undelivered Order Obligation (UDO) reconciliation requirements.
• File and store all documentation according to the FMB configuration management plan and file record system.
• Assist in creating, processing, and following through on financial documentation for knowledge management and auditing authorities.
• Assist in the creation of FMB-related PowerPoint presentations (*proficient in all Microsoft Software applications) (Senior Level preferred).

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Bachelor's degree in operations research, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
• At least 7 years of experience in data analysis, preferably in a government or military context.
• Strong analytical skills, including proficiency in statistical analysis, data modeling, and visualization tools.
• Experience with database design and management, data collection, and data cleaning.
• Familiarity with data analysis programming languages (e.g., Python, R) and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI).
• Strong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to effectively present data insights to a non-technical audience.
• Ability to work independently and as part of a team in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
• Active Top Secret Clearance
• Experience supporting FEMA desired

Job Description:
Overview

TSI is recruiting for a Data Analyst to support our team at Eglin AFB, FL.

Duties:

Perform Data Analyst tasks to support functional areas as described below:
• Coordinates with the civilian facility business office to establish a workflow to receive workload performed by military providers/surgeons monthly
• Coordinates with the military providers/surgeons working at civilian facilities to collect data monthly
• Coordinates with clinical coding to receive associated CPT codes for all of the providers/surgeons procedures.
• Documents all information collected on the AFMRA External Workload Capture Form and submit to AFMRA/SGAR no later than (NLT) the 15ᵗʰ of the following month. For example, procedures performed during Oct 2020 would be submitted to AFMRA/SGAR NLT 15 Nov 2020. Once the workflow is established, a flat file from the civilian facility may be submitted in lieu of the AFMRA External Workload Capture Form NLT the 15ᵗʰ of the following month after it has been screened for all applicable data.
• Coordinates with the MTF Resource Management Office (RMO) to determine the workspace within the MTF. Ensure labor hours are correctly reported in Defense Medical Human Resources System internet (DMHRSi) for support to the MTF as indicated by the RMO staff.
• Coordinates between the providers/surgeons working at the civilian facility and the RMO staff to ensure labor hours are reported accurately in DMHRSi. A unique DMHRSi labor codes FALF for CONUS locations and FALO for OCONUS locations were created to report providers/surgeons time when working at the civilian facility.
• Handles multiple projects and appropriately prioritize tasks to meet deadlines.
• The data analysts shall collect all procedures being performed at the civilian facilities by military providers/surgeons, coordinate with clinical coding to list applicable current procedural terminology (CPT) codes, document the information on the External Workload Capture Form

Education/Experience Requirements:
• Associate’s Degree in a business or related field (e.g. business management, computer information systems, healthcare, and health management).
• Knowledge and understanding of Military Health System (MHS) guidelines.

Data Analyst

At Rectangle Health, we believe that our team members are our most important asset. We grow our team by hiring best-in-class talent. We encourage all employees to contribute their individual talents and ideas to strengthen our team, our brand, and our services. We promote a culture that serves to empower and motivate employees beyond the standard corporate rhetoric one might see on motivational posters. Employees understand their individual roles in serving our customers, and this clarity of purpose encourages high job performance.

Position Overview:

Primary Job Duties

Deliver financial, operation, and sales reporting including KPIs and metrics

· Develop analytic reports and dashboards utilizing various databases and data sources

· Ensure the accuracy of data and maintain data integrity

· Develop reports in Excel including advanced formula, pivot table functionality

· Work closely with business stakeholders to fulfill their data needs

· Work with large amounts of data in SQL Server including building complex queries

· Work with Salesforce to map, align, obtain, and maintain data and reporting

· Develop and support the reporting processes; Identify areas to increase efficiency and automate the reporting process through technical skills such as SQL, R, Excel VBA, Python

· Create data dashboard, charts, and visualization in MS Excel, Tableau, or other tools

· Perform analytical skills and provide insight to the management team

Minimum Qualifications

· Bachelor’s Degree or above in Data Analytics, Statistics, Finance, or other equivalent majors.

· At least 2 years experience in data analytics-related role

· Attention to details

· Strong expertise in MS Excel skills, such as Pivot Table, Advanced Formula, and Graphics, is required.

· Experience in SQL is required

· Knowledge of R or Python for data cleaning and data manipulation is highly preferred

· Experience in Financial and SaaS reporting is highly preferred

· Exceptional Communication Skills

· Familiarity with Excel VBA, Python, and Tableau is a plus

· Experience in SaaS and Payment company is a plus

· Experience in Salesforce reports and dashboards is a plus

· Ability to work in EST Time zone

About Us:

Rectangle Health, a leading financial technology company, empowers medical, dental and specialty practices with seamless and secure technology to drive revenue by increasing patient payments and streamlining practice management and payment processing. Since 1992, the company’s innovative solutions have reduced administrative burden and rebalanced the ledger for its thousands of healthcare providers in the U.S., reliably processing billions of dollars in payments annually.

At least 2 years experience in data analytics-related role

data.job_description:
CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for a Data Analyst to work remotely in the United States. Take a look at the description below. If you think your skills and experience, make you a good match for this position, we’d love to hear from you. We’re looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.

ABOUT OUR FIRM
CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.

ABOUT THE ROLE
As a member of the Data Visualization team, you be a critical interface between the team and the company. You will meet with stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions. You will gather data from primary and secondary sources, develop analytic processes and deliver results through dashboards and presentations.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
• Ingest, analyze and report on data from public and private sources
• Develop and implement databases, data pipelines and analytic strategies can efficiently deliver results
• Create business intelligence dashboards and lightweight decision support tools
• Clean and filter data from multiple data sources
• Identify, analyze and interpret trends in complex datasets
• Work with the team to prioritize needs based on data availability, business impact and strategic goals
• Interface with stakeholders to collect requirements, define scope and present results

ABOUT YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
• Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Data Science, Mathematics, related degree or equivalent certifications
• 3 - 6 years of work experience as a Data Analyst, or similar role
• Expertise in data modeling, data mining and segmentation techniques
• Experience parsing a variety of data sources (CSV, JSON)
• Strong knowledge and experience with BI tools (PowerBI, Tableau)
• Experience interfacing with databases and modern data platforms (SQL, Apache Spark Notebooks)
• Knowledge of programming languages used for advanced analysis (Python, R, Jupyter Notebooks)
• Experience using Excel and other analysis packages for analyzing datasets
• Strong communication and presentation skills

As a Federal Contractor, CannonDesign is required to comply with President Biden's Executive Order 14042. Therefore, as a condition of employment, all employees must provide proof of receipt of a full COVID-19 vaccination unless qualified for a valid medical or religious accommodation.

The salary range for this position is $60,000 to $80,000 annually. This salary range is the range we believe is the anticipated range of possible base compensation at the timing of the posting. We may ultimately pay more or less than the anticipated salary range for the position. Employees may be eligible for discretionary bonuses. We offer a full benefit package including medical, dental and vision coverage and flexible spending account options and voluntary insurances. We have paid time off, flex-time summer hours, remote work options and a 401k plan and employee perk programs. For a general overview of our benefits, please visit our careers page at www.cannondesign.com/careers/. Actual compensation may vary from posting based on geographic location, work experience, education and/or skill level.

ABOUT WORKING HERE
• We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about.
• We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives.
• We’re about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we’re ready for you.

For a general overview of our benefits, please visit our careers page at www.cannondesign.com/careers/

Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.

As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.

CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce. We are committed to equal opportunity. We consider all qualified employment applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, partnership status, protected veteran status, disability, or any other status protected by federal, state, or local law. Individuals who hold legal work authorization applicable to employment at CannonDesign in the United States will be considered without regard to citizenship/alienage.

data.job_title: Investigations and Insights Lead Data Analyst - USDS
data.job_description:
Investigations and Insights Lead Data Analyst - USDS

New York
Regular
Operations
Job ID: A96556

Responsibilities

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire
• for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform.

We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

About USDS At TikTok, we're committed to a process of continuous innovation and improvement in our user experience and safety controls. We're proud to be able to serve a global community of more than a billion people who use TikTok to creatively express themselves and be entertained, and we're dedicated to giving them a platform that builds opportunity and fosters connection.

We also take our responsibility to safeguard our community seriously, both in how we address potentially harmful content and how we protect against unauthorized access to user data. U.S. Data Security (“USDS”) is a standalone department of TikTok in the U.S. This new security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.S. users safe. Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and user data in the U.S., so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained.

The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more. The USDS Trust & Safety team at TikTok helps ensure that our global community is safe and empowered to create and enjoy content across all of our applications. We are seeking an experienced Lead Threat Data Analyst to join the Trust and Safety organization within USDS.

You will use your investigative and adversarial mindset to help us identify our gaps before nefarious actors beat us to it. You will be leading a team of cross-functional subject matter experts in technical feature abuse, violent extremism, hate, and integrity and authenticity to data mine threat actor abuse tactics, develop predictive models, and conduct comprehensive proactive and reactive investigations. You will closely collaborate with other leads, engineers, and behavioral scientists to resolve complex threats that reach across topic or feature areas and may require network analysis and the creation of detection pipelines, prioritizing actionability in your recommendations and continually iterating solutions to scale your impact.

The work of the Investigations and Insights team is critical to TikTok user safety, and the Lead Threat Data Analyst will have the opportunity to identify and mitigate the most harmful threats targeting the platform and our users. Responsibilities
• Create and drive a 1
• and 3-year roadmap and vision for the vertical.
• Build and train a team of data scientists and data analysts to execute the roadmap.
• Work cross-functionally with product managers, program managers, operations, policy, and communications teams to find gaps in current threat response processes such as detection and mitigation.
• Develop and test predictive models of feature abuse.
• Data mine threat actor behaviors and tactics.
• Work with a team of experts that not only respond to known bad actors, but proactively search and identify potential threats in order to build scalable protections to keep them out.
• Identify deceptive behavior of threat actors, and collect and analyze signals through data analysis, and work with engineers to improve detection models and develop data driven mitigation strategies.
• Actively strengthen intelligence gathering and investigation standard operating procedures.

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Engineering, Criminal Organizations, Economics, Business, Cybersecurity, other relevant field, or equivalent experience
• 4-7 years of experience in threat discovery and prevention or related fields, including 3+ years of experience in detecting threats related to violent extremism, hate, integrity and authenticity OR across text-related features.
• Advanced proficiency in SQL or other relational database languages
• Intermediate understanding of descriptive statistics
• Beginning proficiency in a functional or object oriented programming language (e.g. Python, R)
• Ability to create advanced data visualizations
• 3 years of experience leading teams, mentoring junior staff, and managing stakeholder relationships
• Project management skills to ensure impactful output, achieve stakeholder alignment, and manage competing priorities
• A proven record of identifying signals of nefarious behavior or feature abuse and using creativity with experience to mitigate complex threats

Preferred Qualifications
• Work with little oversight and take initiative
• Independently troubleshoot technical issues or bugs
• Strategically plan priorities and scope projects
• Rapidly shift priorities based on evolving challenges to the platform
• Identify anomalous behavior and determine ways for further exploring new research leads
• Communicate coherently and crisply to incident response teams and senior leadership
• Communicate complex concepts to broader stakeholders without shared expertise
• Work across time zones with global team members and stakeholders

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too. TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our recruitment processes for candidates with disabilities, pregnancy, sincerely held religious beliefs or other reasons protected by applicable laws.

If you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation, please reach out to us at Recruiting.Corp@tiktok.com.

Job Information

The base salary range for this position in the selected city is $130133 - $232222 annually.​

Compensation may vary outside of this range depending on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies and experience, and location. Base pay is one part of the Total Package that is provided to compensate and recognize employees for their work, and this role may be eligible for additional discretionary bonuses/incentives, and restricted stock units.​

At ByteDance/TikTok our benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support ByteDancers to give their best in both work and life. We offer the following benefits to eligible employees: ​

We cover 100% premium coverage for employee medical insurance, approximately 75% premium coverage for dependents and offer a Health Savings Account(HSA) with a company match. As well as Dental, Vision, Short/Long term Disability, Basic Life, Voluntary Life and AD&D insurance plans. In addition to Flexible Spending Account(FSA) Options like Health Care, Limited Purpose and Dependent Care. ​

Our time off and leave plans are: 10 paid holidays per year plus 17 days of Paid Personal Time Off(PPTO) (prorated upon hire and increased by tenure) and 10 paid sick days per year as well as 12 weeks of paid Parental leave and 8 weeks of paid Supplemental Disability. ​

We also provide generous benefits like mental and emotional health benefits through our EAP and Lyra. A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements. The Company reserves the right to modify or change these benefits programs at any time, with or without notice.​
