Will work under the direction of the Supply Chain Analytics Manager and will fill a cross functional role providing analytics and data analysis to all areas of the health system supply chain
This role will also assist with various system process improvement initiatives and ad hoc analytic projects as assigned
This role drives success within the health system by providing an essential analytic foundation
Must be able to perform the professional, clinical and or technical competencies of the assigned unit or department
Support initiatives through data analysis and the development of data visualizations
Assists in the planning and design of data analytic projects
Contribute to continuous improvement projects by developing tools and standard templates
Assists with defining data standards and definitions
Leads discussions with cross functional teams on the results of projects and data analysis
Produce financial analysis for cost savings initiatives
Gather data and produce accurate and timely analytics for department leaders
Serve as a subject matter expert on supply chain analytics tools and methodologies

Description

The successful business analyst candidate will be a team-oriented individual with a desire to help the organization continuously better serve its prospects and clients with creative problem solving.

We offer an outstanding benefits package, including medical, dental, life, disability, 401(k), vacation, sick leave and paid holidays. We pay 100% of the employee medical and dental insurance premiums and make employer health savings account contributions.

The primary function of this entry-to-intermediate level position is to investigate and clean data, make recommendations for processes and automations, and enhance and help automate current processes with existing system infrastructure via collaborative and independent effort. This person works closely with team and firm management along with client-facing professionals across teams and institutions to improve and enhance data-driven processes including management reporting and both internal and client-facing systems and applications integrations.

data.job_description:
A BIT ABOUT YOU:

You're passionate and extremely motivated. You've got an ambitious spirit at heart. You're resourceful, innovative, forward-thinking, and committed. And of course (because we're Atmosfy after all!) you absolutely love travel, discovering new restaurants, nightlife, and experiences. If this sounds like you then read on friend!

As a Data Analyst at Atmosfy, you are responsible for conducting analysis to support the Product Team. In this role, you will be responsible for developing insights for the product roadmap, leading research and KPI strategies, to generate tangible insights in support of the execution of the roadmap. You are a fierce ambitious thinker with a passion for inspiring quality, innovation, and continuous improvement. This is a 100% remote, flexible role.

Compensation:

$60,000 - $90,000 yearly

Responsibilities:

WHAT YOU'LL LEAD:
• You will be responsible for owning end-to-end dashboard development including requirement gathering.
• Monitor & maintain existing dashboards in production
• Identify opportunities and influence partners to act: Provide insights to the leadership team on the impact of strategic initiatives on the key metrics
• Drive self-serve and data literacy: democratize data by building and socializing decision tools (dashboards, reports); build key data sets/pipelines to empower operational and exploratory analysis
• Define, implement and standardize metrics, reports, and dashboards

Qualifications:

WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR?
• Bachelor's degree in MIS, Business, Finance, or a related field, or equivalent experience
• 1+ years of working experience in data, analytics, or other relevant roles
• Must be highly proficient in SQL and Excel
• Amplitude experience is preferred
• Experience in requirement gathering & process documentation
• Ability to work cross-functionally in a fast-paced & rapidly changing environment
• Ability to tell stories with data, educate effectively, and instill confidence, motivating stakeholders to act on recommendations
• Ability to influence business decisions and utilize data at the leadership level

PERKS & BENEFITS
• Completely remote, flexible work schedule
• Unlimited Vacation, Paid Sick Days & Holidays
• Employee Covered Medical, Dental, Vision Plan Base Plan
• Dining/Nightlife Stipend
• Company Events

About Company

We are Atmosfy.

And we're the fastest growing platform globally for live video of dining and nightlife - that shows you what's happening in your city in real-time. More than that, though - we help support local businesses globally by sharing unique experiences through video. How cool is that? We help people in more than 150 countries and 10,000+ cities discover the world's best experiences.

Our team draws on talented people who have worked at best-in-class companies such as Instagram, Google, and Netflix. We are funded by world-class investors.

Check us out on the App Store or Google Play to learn more about our mission to share experiences, inspire others, and support local businesses around the world.

You're resourceful, innovative, forward-thinking, and committed

data.job_title: Fraud Data Analyst, Fraud Platform Integrity (Remote)
data.job_description:
Employee Applicant Privacy Notice
Who we are:
Shape a brighter financial future with us.
Together with our members, we're changing the way people think about and interact with personal finance.
We're a next-generation fintech company using innovative, mobile-first technology to help our millions of members reach their goals. The industry is going through an unprecedented transformation, and we're at the forefront. We're proud to come to work every day knowing that what we do has a direct impact on people's lives, with our core values guiding us every step of the way. Join us to invest in yourself, your career, and the financial world.
The Role
We are looking for a talented data analyst to join our growing Fraud Platform Integrity team. The Fraud Platform and Integrity team is tasked with partnering with Risk Infrastructure, Fraud Policy, Product and Engineering teams to drive the enhancement of fraud prevention infrastructure. This includes assessment of 3rd party fraud vendors to accelerate fraud prevention capabilities and fraud incident management. The ideal candidate should be familiar with SQL and Python and have experience working with Snowflake and Tableau. They will be required to work independently and will need to be self-motivated to achieve the company's objectives in fraud prevention. The mission is to continue to iterate and develop a world class fraud prevention platform. We want to hear from you if you love working with data and are passionate about doing the right thing!
What you'll do:
The Fraud Prevention Data Analyst will be responsible for the following:
• Analyze large datasets to identify fraudulent activities and trends.
• Monitor fraud patterns and identify potential risks and threats.
• Build reports and dashboards in Tableau to provide insights and trends to management.
• Continuously monitor fraud prevention measures to ensure effectiveness and identify areas for improvement.
• Conduct ad hoc analysis as required to support fraud prevention efforts.
• Create models to optimize fraud vendor costs.

What you'll need:
• 4+ years of data analysis experience preferably with focus on risk management and/or fraud prevention
• A degree in a quantitative field of study (e.g., Statistics, Finance, Economics, Math, Sciences, Engineering)
• Mastery of SQL and a strong understanding of data relationships / relational databases, experience working with large datasets. Proficiency in Python is highly preferred.
• Extensive experience and passion for metrics and dashboards visualizations on Tableau.
• Proven skills in A/B testing, experiment set-up, and analysis

Nice to Have:
• Experience working with multiple cross-functional teams to deliver results
• Experience in banking and/or fintech industry
• Experience storytelling through data.
• Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and techniques.
• Knowledge of fraud prevention tools and techniques.

Compensation and Benefits
The base pay range for this role is listed below. Final base pay offer will be determined based on individual factors such as the candidate's experience, skills, and location.
To view all of our comprehensive and competitive benefits, visit our Benefits at SoFi page!
SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.
Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.
New York applicants: Notice of Employee Rights
SoFi is committed to embracing diversity. As part of this commitment, SoFi offers reasonable accommodations to candidates with physical or mental disabilities. If you need accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, please let your recruiter know or email accommodations@sofi.com.
Due to insurance coverage issues, we are unable to accommodate remote work from Hawaii or Alaska at this time.
Internal Employees
If you are a current employee, do not apply here - please navigate to our Internal Job Board in Greenhouse to apply to our open roles.

data.job_title: Data analyst/BI expert to help for analytics reports
data.job_description:
This assignment assesses all three of the module’s learning outcomes:

1. Understand and critically discuss the whole data analytics lifecycle.

2. Plan and execute a small data analytics project.

3. Practice critical and creative thinking; Logical and analytical skills related to understanding business

and data requirements, and analysing, interpreting and visualising data; Quantitative skills related to

analysing and interpreting data; Communications skills (presentation and written English).

For this assessment you will need to undertake and report on a complete business analytics project using the

dataset provided below. Your aim is to create valuable insights for your client-user. For this assessment you

will have to undertake or consider, and report on, the whole business analytics cycle (CRISP-DM model), from

business understanding, through data understanding, data preparation, modelling or analysis to an

evaluation of your results, and a consideration of the issues involved in deployment

Report

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Your professional report should consider the following issues:

• Business Understanding: Your critical understanding of the client’s concerns, strategy and vision.

• Data Understanding: You critical understanding of the data sources that you have used, including

the way the data are organised (entities, relationships, cardinalities), their information content

(including descriptive statistics of their values), and any other issues that may become relevant. Also,

consider alternative sources, and any legal, ethical and governance issues involved in the data

acquisition and storage.

• The steps you undertook to prepare – that is select, clean and integrate – the data that you have

used (including a justification for why you have undertaken these steps).

• The specific analysis or modelling you have undertaken (again, including a justification for your

choice of analysis).

• A presentation of the main results of your analysis, e.g., as a dashboard, map or other format that is

relevant for the dataset of your choice.

• A critical evaluation of your findings for the client including the strengths and limitations of both the

data that you have used and the analytical techniques adopted.

• A brief suggestion for next steps and the sustainable deployment of your work.

• A full list of all material referenced in the main text.

Your report needs to meet professional standards of presentation, English language, and academic

referencing using the Harvard method.

Your report may contain appendices such as data dictionaries and extended diagrams and alternative

information presentation formats. These will not be marked but can contain supporting information.

You have to work and report on the following case:

Your client is an NHS trust in England which aims to improve its response to Covid-19 in its area. The trust is

specifically concerned with reducing the prevalence of, and number of deaths from, Covid-19 by nonmedical/pharmaceutical interventions such as improved nutrition. Your task is to take the data -from

countries around the world- on protein and fat intake, and amount and calorific intake from different

sources as well as obesity and undernourishment levels, and Covid-19 prevalence and outcomes. You will

need to link and cleanse the data to create a database. Your analysis should explore the link between levels

of obesity and undernourishment and the prevalence of and mortality from Covid-19 as well as the link

between specific nutritional choices (e.g. sources of fat and protein intake, calorific load and amount) and

susceptibility to Covid-19 infection and death from it. To delight your client you also need to provide some

new insights into the factors that are associated with nutrition and Covid-19 outcomes. The data is available

here:

data.job_description:
Dave is one of the leading US neobanks and a pioneer in financial services, using disruptive technology to provide best in class banking services to millions of members at a fraction of the cost compared to incumbents. The anchor of our banking value proposition, ExtraCash, provides up to $500 of short term, interest free advances to members within minutes of joining. The speed to value, access and pricing of ExtraCash compared to traditional overdraft sets us apart from incumbents and is a key to our strategy to efficiently acquire transacting Dave debit card members.

Dave is looking for an experienced Lead Data Analyst to spearhead analyses and provide meaningful insights into our users and product. The Lead Data Analyst will leverage data on our users to build dashboards, answer key business questions, and tell compelling stories. This person will conduct in-depth analyses of our data, report on key metrics, and provide recommendations that will have a direct impact in shaping future product development and company initiatives. The ideal candidate is an intelligent, sharp, detail-oriented, and highly quantitative individual who loves working with and analyzing data.

What You'll Do
• Be constantly curious and continue to pursue in-depth explorations of our datasets
• Develop and adjust risk rules to optimize fraud detection across different business areas and products while limiting negative impact to good users
• Develop data-driven risk decision strategies to support the business’ financial goals, monitor their impact and adjust it according to the dynamic world we operate in
• Work with Dave’s detailed business data to optimize performance and minimize financial loss
• Advocate for your data products by contributing to business cases that improve prioritization and identify new trends and opportunities for your space
• Cultivate relationships with partners across risk product, risk operations and risk engineering to remove roadblocks and provide insights to build the risk/fraud roadmap
• Create analytical frameworks to measure team success by partnering with teams to determine success metrics, creating approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, measuring and evaluating the data and then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these indicators
• Work independently and proficiently to be accountable for your own results. Reviews are mainly for consultation and sharing ideas
• Ad-hoc analysis to address urgent high impact analysis for business stakeholders

What You'll Need
• 7+ years of quantitative analyses experience in the Financial industry to build data-driven strategy for solving risk management/fraud detection problems
• Proficient in SQL and/or other data query languages, familiarity with Python is a plus
• Has solid knowledge of internal and external business processes and data, systems and flows, as well as analytical tools, processes, and methodologies, solutions to do the job with a high level of proficiency and quality
• Has some basic understanding of business and finance in the context of the mobile banking business
• Experience collaborating with and understanding the needs of stakeholders from a variety of business functions, including product, risk, compliance, finance and so on
• Bachelor’s degree in any field which requires logical creative thinking, STEM majors MS degree preferred
• Proven strong analytical and problem-solving skills
• Previous experience with Business Intelligence tool (i.e. Tableau, Looker, Mode, or Periscope)
• Experience in Financial Services or FinTech preferred
• Previous work on evaluating product iterations or experiments

Nice to Haves
• Knowledge of ACH returns, chargebacks
• Experience in quickly identifying fraud attack patterns and come up with solutions to reduce fraud losses

Technologies we Use and Teach
• SQL
• Python
• R
• A/B testing

$169,000 - $271,000 a year
Dave has established a nationally applicable pay program that recognizes that regardless of where Daves choose to live, their time and effort is of equal value to the company. As such we utilize base salary ranges that are intended to be competitive in all markets and do not differentiate pay based on employee work location.

Don’t let imposter syndrome get in your way of an incredible opportunity. We’re looking for people who can help us achieve our mission and vision, not just check off the boxes. If you’re excited about this role, we encourage you to apply. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles.

Why you’ll love working here:

At Dave, our people are just as important as our product. Our culture is a reflection of our values that guide who we are, how we work, and what we aspire to be. Daves are member centric, helpful, transparent, persistent, and better together. We strive to create an environment where all Daves feel valued, heard, and empowered to do their best work. As a virtual first company, team members can live and work anywhere in the United States, with the exception of Hawaii.

A few of our benefits & perks:

• Opportunity to tackle tough challenges, learn and grow from fellow top talent, and help millions of people reach their personal financial goals

• Flexible hours and virtual first work culture with a home office stipend

• Premium Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance plans

• Generous paid parental and caregiver leave

• 401(k) savings plan with matching contributions

• Financial advisor and financial wellness support

• Flexible PTO and generous company holidays, including Juneteenth and Winter Break

• All-company in-person events once or twice a year and virtual events throughout to connect with your team members and leadership team

Dave, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and is dedicated to cultivating a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider for employment all qualified applicants and do not discriminate on any basis protected by federal, state, or local law, including the City of Los Angeles’ Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance relating to an applicant's criminal history.

Create analytical frameworks to measure team success by partnering with teams to determine success metrics, creating approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, measuring and evaluating the data and then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these indicators
Work independently and proficiently to be accountable for your own results
Reviews are mainly for consultation and sharing ideas
Ad-hoc analysis to address urgent high impact analysis for business stakeholders
Benefits: Opportunity to tackle tough challenges, learn and grow from fellow top talent, and help millions of people reach their personal financial goals
Flexible hours and virtual first work culture with a home office stipend
Premium Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance plans
Generous paid parental and caregiver leave
401(k) savings plan with matching contributions
Financial advisor and financial wellness support
Flexible PTO and generous company holidays, including Juneteenth and Winter Break
All-company in-person events once or twice a year and virtual events throughout to connect with your team members and leadership team

You could be the one who changes everything for our 26 million members. Centene is transforming the health of our communities, one person at a time. As a diversified, national organization, you’ll have access to competitive benefits including a fresh perspective on workplace flexibility.

Position Purpose: Analyze integrated and extensive datasets to extract value, which directly impacts and influences business decisions. Work collaboratively with key business stakeholders to identify areas of value, develop solutions, and deliver insights to reduce overall cost of care for members and improve their clinical outcomes.

Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including healthcare provider, member/patient, and third-party data.

Support execution of large-scale projects with limited direction from leadership

Identify and perform root-cause analysis of data irregularities and present findings and proposed solutions to leadership and/or customers

Manage multiple, variable tasks and data review processes with limited supervision within targeted timelines

Support the design, testing, and implementation of process enhancements and identify opportunities for automation

Apply expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how customers interact with analytic products

Support multiple functions and levels of the organization and effectively, both verbally and visually, communicate findings and insights to non-technical business partners

Independently engage with customers and business partners to gather requirements and validate results

Communicate and present data-driven insights and recommendations to both internal and external stakeholders, soliciting and incorporating feedback when required

Basic qualifications: One year of permanent service as a Data Analyst 1 OR bachelor’s degree in data or computer science, informatics, economics, statistics, mathematics, or a related field, and three years of experience in data visualization, and statistical models and data mining tools.

The NYSIF Claims Department is seeking an experienced Data Analyst to lead the production of decision intelligence solutions for our Data and Innovation initiatives. The successful candidate will exhibit a high degree of flexibility, ability to learn new tools and methods of analysis, and have a strong commitment to performing high quality analysis.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
• Produces business intelligence solutions by performing data extraction with tools such as Spotfire, SQL & R, including user-centric dashboards, predictive modeling, data analytics, and periodic reports
• Identify data patterns and trends, research new sources of data, and recommend solutions
• Devises methods for identifying data patterns, trend identification and root cause analysis
• Manage research projects and perform independent data analysis as required by Claims Department leadership and recommend improvements
• Conducts or coordinates tests to ensure that business intelligence solutions are consistent with defined needs
• Assesses data structures and how they can be used to produce desired reports
• Maintain life cycle of data solutions to ensure accuracy and integrity
• Assist Data Analyst 1 in the organization and prioritization of data requests
• Supervise lower-level staff
• Manage research projects and analyze data needed by Executive and NYSIF departments
• Assist the Data Analyst 1 in the organization and the prioritization of numerous data requests

Please note the following New York State Civil Service employment information:
• Jurisdictional classification: Non-Competitive
• Bargaining unit: PEF

The New York State Insurance Fund (NYSIF) was established in 1914 as part of the original enactment of the

New York State Workers’ Compensation Law. NYSIF's mission is to guarantee the availability of workers’ compensation insurance at the lowest possible cost to

New York employers and to provide timely, appropriate indemnity and medical payments to injured workers, while maintaining a solvent fund. Since inception, NYSIF has fulfilled the dual roles for which it was created: to compete with other carriers to ensure a fair marketplace and to be a guaranteed source of coverage for employers who cannot secure coverage elsewhere.

NYSIF is the largest workers’ compensation carrier in New York State and among the top 10 largest workers’ compensation carriers in the nation, insuring approximately 139,000 policyholders, with more than $1.8 billion in annual earned premium and over $22 billion in assets. A self-supporting insurance carrier, NYSIF operates without taxpayer funding.

In addition to workers’ compensation insurance, NYSIF provides disability benefits coverage for off-the-job injuries to more than 56,000 New York employers. In 2018, NYSIF added paid family leave as a component of its disability benefits product, providing New Yorkers with job-protected, paid time away from work to care for their families.

NYSIF Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion

The New York State Insurance Fund (NYSIF) prioritizes and champions diversity, equity, and inclusion (DEI) throughout our agency.

NYSIF provides equal opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other protected category under federal, state, and local law. We believe that embracing our differences brings richness, new ideas and experiences to NYSIF, which energizes a creative and innovative work environment. We strive to foster a workplace where diverse individuals are able to participate fully in the decision-making process and have ample opportunity for advancement.

We are committed to investing the necessary resources and attention to improving the engagement, retention, and promotion of the extraordinary talent we have.

NYSIF has a telecommuting program (up to 50%).

Some positions may require additional credentials or a background check to verify your identity.

data.job_description:
We're a Little Different

Our mission is clear. We bring to life a healing ministry through our compassionate care and exceptional service.

At Mercy, we believe in careers that match the unique gifts of unique individuals - careers that not only make the most of your skills and talents, but also your heart. Join us and discover why Modern Healthcare Magazine named us in its "Top 100 Places to Work."

Overview:

The Clinical Quality Outcomes team is a dynamic group with clinical, technical and financial experience that partners with leaders across the Ministry.

Our team leverages its expertise with interpretation of quality measures, new payment models, statistical analysis, data modeling, visualization development and electronic health record data mining to achieve the purpose statement of the Mercy Quality and Safety department:

Mercy Quality and Safety will drive high reliability outcomes, accountability, clinical excellence and remove unnecessary variation. The effective alignment of people, processes and technology will provide the best care to our patients by eliminating harm and realizing the quadruple aim.

The Clinical Quality Outcomes Analyst will work collaboratively with the Mercy Quality and Safety team and leaders from multiple departments to coordinate the evaluation and implementation of analytics strategies across the Ministry.

The role requires the ability to analyze healthcare data from conceptualization through presentation and coordination of multiple data-related projects and initiatives.

Proficiency with analytical tools, knowledge of data analysis methodology, use of presentation software, strong communication skills and a strong commitment to and affinity for delivering the highest level of performance on quality metrics is essential for this role.

Performs duties and responsibilities in a manner consistent with our mission, values, and Mercy Service Standards.

Qualifications:
• Experience: 2 years of relevant technical or business work experience. Strong understanding of database structure, design, query languages (e.g. SQL/Oracle). Technical business intelligence solution design experience in data modeling, query optimization, enterprise level solutions, etc. Experience working with a variety of information systems and data files. Demonstrated experience in analysis and presentation of data. Experience with a minimum of one business intelligence or data visualization platform (e.g., QlikView, Tableau) Experience developing solid, effective and efficient analytics solutions that are supportable. Practical experience building and evaluating visualizations. An understanding of the key techniques used in visualization, including the ability to use multiple visualizations to convey a meaningful narrative
• Required Education: Bachelors degree in information technology, computer science, public health or other relevant field or equivalent work experience
• Other: Creative thinker with strong collaborative and workflow analysis skills. Critical thinking skills with the ability to quickly make calculated decisions from limited written and/or oral information. Exceptional communication skills with all levels of management; ability to express oneself in writing and orally; and comfortable speaking in groups. Ability to establish cooperative working relationships with diverse groups and individuals, medical staff and other health care disciplines and interact with all levels of employees. Knowledge and experience in applying principles of continuous quality improvement within a complex organization
• Preferred Education: MBA, MS, MPH or MA
• Preferred Experience: Experience in a health care setting. Experience with electronic health record(s) and querying electronic health record databases. Experience with SPSS or SAS. Experience applying statistical tests to data
• Certification: Epic Clarity
• Other Skills and Knowledge: Familiarity with various types of quality sources related to health care data. Strong understanding of CMS programs, e.g., Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program, and the data required to improve performance with programs.

We Offer Great Benefits:

Day-one comprehensive health, vision and dental coverage, PTO, tuition reimbursement and employer-matched retirement funds are just a few of the great benefits offered to eligible co-workers, including those working 32 hours or more per pay period!

We're bringing to life a healing ministry through compassionate care.

At Mercy, our supportive community will be behind you every step of your day, especially the tough ones. You will have opportunities to pioneer new models of care and transform the health care experience through advanced technology and innovative procedures. We're expanding to help our communities grow. Join us and be a part of it all.

What Makes You a Good Match for Mercy?

Compassion and professionalism go hand-in-hand with us. Having a positive outlook and a strong sense of advocacy is in perfect step with our mission and vision. We're also collaborative and unafraid to do a little extra to deliver excellent care - that's just part of our commitment. If that sounds like a good fit for you, we encourage you to apply.

data.job_description:
About Mynd:

Mynd is a tech-enabled real estate company serving the $85B+ property management and real estate investment market. In the past few years, consumers have gained access to free stock trades, greater transparency in the mortgage market, and apps that make managing their money more convenient. Yet real estate investment, the most powerful tool for building generational wealth, has largely been the purview of wealthier individuals and professional money managers.

Mynd is determined to overhaul that paradigm.

At Mynd, were on a mission to democratize access to happy homes and sustainable investments by making the purchase of single-family residential real estate as effortless as other types of investments. Investing in real estate can be intimidating, especially for first-time buyers. Moreover, many potential investors dont want to buy real estate in their geographic area, or have been priced out of competitive big city housing markets.

With operations in 25 markets across the U.S. and real-time insights via our platform, we remove the time, communication, and geographic barriers traditionally associated with buying real estate. Investors can now find, purchase, lease, manage, and sell single-family rental properties 100 percent remotely.

Mynd is Best Places to Work certified, a Built In SF Best Places to Work 2022 winner, and was named the #1 fastest-growing East Bay company by the San Francisco Business Times in 2021. Weve attracted talent from Starwood Waypoint Homes, The New York Times, McKinsey, BCG, Compass, Better, One Medical, Zillow, Upwork, WeWork, and Facebook. Were backed by top VCs, including Lightspeed, Canaan, Jackson Square, and QED, and recently announced a $5 billion deal with Invesco Real Estate that will make us the largest buyer of single-family rental homes in the country.

Join us!

As a Data Analyst at Mynd, you will be a key member of the Data team and have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our business. You will use your technical skills and business acumen to extract insights from our data, helping us make better decisions and drive growth. This is a great opportunity for a data-driven individual who wants to work in the exciting and fast-growing tech-enabled real estate space.

Responsibilities:
• Collect, process, and analyze large and complex datasets to identify trends and patterns
• Develop dashboards and reports to provide insights to the business and track key metrics
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve problems using data
• Work with data engineers in the building and maintenance of data pipelines to ensure accuracy and reliability of our data
• Continuously improve our data and analytics processes, tools and systems
• Work with engineers to build and maintain data pipelines, ensuring accuracy and reliability of our data
• Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies to help Mynd maintain its competitive advantage

Qualifications:
• Bachelors or Masters degree in a related field (e.g. Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering)
• 2+ years of experience in a data analysis or similar role
• Strong proficiency in SQL and experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, Looker, Sigma)
• Experience with programming languages (e.g. Python, R) is a big plus
• Ability to communicate complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders
• Proven track record of using data to drive business decisions and solve complex problems
• Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills
• Excellent attention to detail and ability to work independently and in a team environment

Being authorized to work in the U.S. is a precondition of employment and we are unable to sponsor H1-B Visas at this time.

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background investigation.

Compensation:

$94,000 - $127,000 annually. The compensation range may be adjusted based on experience and location.

At Mynd, we offer a robust, competitive & unique benefits package:
• Unlimited time off
• 13 Paid holidays
• Paid Parental Leave
• Cash to purchase your own investment property through our Project Investor Myndset program
• 401k + Match
• Wellness, home office, and cell phone subsidies
• Volunteer time off
• Robust health, dental, vision insurance, and more
• Sabbatical program
• Eligible to participate in Mynds equity program

At Mynd, we encourage all of our team members to:
• Be Myndful
• Always Be Entrepreneurial
• Earn Trust
• Play Team First
• Be an A Player
• Think Like An Investor

As part of our dedication to diversity, Mynd is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals seeking employment at Mynd are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status, or any other legally protected category.

data.job_description:
Description

The Data Analyst reports to the Director of Data Management and is an integral member of the Data Management Office. The Data Analyst plays a key role working with subject matter experts to ensure proper utilization of data via analysis, discovery and investigation of potential data quality issues. The Data Analyst will use his or her's skills in data analysis, data mapping, and investigation to help business units and other associates in the data management group deliver key information assets like reports, data integrations, data quality profiles, dashboards and design documents. The data analyst will work on other data related projects as directed by the Manager of the Data Management Office.

Experience with data warehouse environments is highly desirable. Experience with SQL databases and business requirements gathering and creation will be necessary for this position. The Data Analyst will work closely with other team members of the Data Management Group which includes the Data Integration team, Business Intelligence, and Data Governance/Data Quality. The Data Analyst will communicate effectively with other team members and management to deliver results in a timely fashion.

The successful candidate for this role will have 5 or more years working in a similar capacity with excellent communication skills and hands on expertise with data query tools.

Responsibilities
• Work with management to prioritize data and information needs
• Working with subject matter experts and assisting the business analyst to translate needs to business requirements with an emphasis on non-technical, business friendly terms and language.
• Interpret data, analyze results
• Develop data mappings, data flows, and data lineage artifacts.
• Develop expertise in data structures, and data elements to assist other members of the Data Management Office.
• Identify and make recommendations as to acquisition of new sources of data.
• Identify data quality issues and make recommendations to improve the overall quality of data.
• Identify and define new process improvement opportunities

Education and Experience
• BA/BS in Business, computer science, Information Management or related discipline
• Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
• 5+ Years' professional experience

Required Skills
• Strong working knowledge writing queries in structured query language (SQL). Experience with other data manipulation and data preparation techniques and technologies
• Experience with one or more of the major database platforms (Oracle, MS Sql Server, MySql)
• Familiarity and working knowledge MS Office, Visio or other diagramming tools
• Excellent communication skills and the ability to articulate complex ideas and findings
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
• Good working knowledge of data mapping techniques, and writing business requirements
• Experience and exposure to project management concepts and tools
• Required non-technical skills include: written communication, interpersonal skills working in an team environment, complex problem solving, results orientated, adaptability to change, self-motivated, able to see the big picture while delivering tangible results

#remote

The Data Analyst will communicate effectively with other team members and management to deliver results in a timely fashion
Work with management to prioritize data and information needs
Working with subject matter experts and assisting the business analyst to translate needs to business requirements with an emphasis on non-technical, business friendly terms and language
Interpret data, analyze results
Develop data mappings, data flows, and data lineage artifacts
Develop expertise in data structures, and data elements to assist other members of the Data Management Office
Identify and make recommendations as to acquisition of new sources of data
Identify data quality issues and make recommendations to improve the overall quality of data
Identify and define new process improvement opportunities

Overview

Are you looking for a role where you can directly influence an organization in high growth mode? Do you have a knack for solving problems? Do you want to help drive the results of a multi-million-dollar business? If so, you may have found your next role.

We are looking for a talented and motivated Marketing Operational Data Analyst to join our team. The successful candidate will be responsible for analyzing and implementing marketing strategies and campaigns, as well as utilizing technical skills to collect, manage, and analyze data to optimize marketing performance. The Marketing Programmer Analyst will work closely with the marketing team to drive successful campaigns, and report on key metrics and insights to inform marketing strategy and decision-making.

Responsibilities
• Analyze and evaluate marketing strategies and campaigns to drive performance improvements
• Utilize technical skills to collect, manage, and analyze data to optimize marketing performance
• Collaborate with marketing, data analytics and data science team members to create and execute marketing campaigns, including direct mail and email advertising
• Implement tracking mechanisms to monitor marketing performance and provide insights to inform future marketing strategy
• Implement weekly Marketing matrix campaign with A/B tests and data compilation instructions and ensuring accurate and timely data generation outcomes
• Conduct research to stay up-to-date on emerging marketing trends, tools, and technologies
• Report on key marketing metrics and insights to inform marketing strategy and decision-making
• Work closely with cross-functional teams, including sales, product, and engineering, to align marketing efforts with business goals
• Develop and maintain documentation and standard operating procedures to ensure consistency and efficiency in marketing operations

Qualifications
• We appreciate any interest, but unfortunately are unable to accommodate visa transfers or sponsorships for this role, now or in the future.**
• Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Computer Science, or related field preferred
• 2+ years of experience in marketing analytics, marketing, or related field
• Strong technical skills, including proficiency in programming languages such as SQL, Python, and/or R
• Experience with Microsoft Azure platform in general and Azure Synapse analytics is a big plus
• Ability to analyze and interpret data to inform marketing strategy and decision-making
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment
• Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple projects and priorities

A Little About Strategic

Strategic Financial Solutions is an award-winning financial services firm dedicated to helping people live a financially healthy life through the products and services we offer.

We were recently named as one of the Best Companies to Work for in New York State for the 6th time. Additional honors include being named, two times, as one of the 50 fastest growing companies in New York City and to the prestigious Inc. 500 list as one of the 500 fastest growing companies in the United States. Strategic has offices in Manhattan and Buffalo, to house our rapidly growing family of over 750 associate s. We are proud to be a 100% employee-owned company. With a common goal in mind, our team shares in the financial rewards of Strategic’s success through long-term stock ownership. In June 2022 we proudly celebrated our 15th anniversary.

Strategic is committed to hiring, training, cultivating, promoting, and celebrating an environment where we have a welcoming and fulfilling place for all people to call home. Diversity of race, thought, sexual orientation, age, veteran status, religion, and disability will empower us to thrive as individuals, as teams, and as a company.

data.job_description:
The Financial Data Analyst is primarily responsible for providing data analysis via data visualizations.

At Life.Church, we exist to lead people to become fully devoted followers of Christ. It’s been our mission since 1996 and has guided us every day. Leading people isn’t just an expectation; it’s a necessity. It’s a cornerstone of our culture. That's why we’re always seeking leaders—leaders like you—to bring your skills to life. We are one church meeting in multiple locations, and we want to help you become the person God made you to be.

The Finance Team partners with the organization to facilitate the financial reporting needs of Life.Church, including payroll, accounts payable, giving operations, accounting, forecasting, and data analytics. We equip the organization with the tools needed to plan for, understand, and steward the resources God has provided for our ministry.

The Financial Data Analyst will use SQL and other programming languages to query, summarize, and analyze key metrics and develop data visualizations for the Financial Operations Group (FOG) in support of Life.Church and YouVersion. This position ensures data integrity and provides technical support & maintenance across all FOG systems. The Financial Data Analyst acts as an advocate and vital technical resource for all FOG teams through implementing new processes and maintaining operational integrity in partnership with both internal departments and external service providers or vendors.

What You'll Do
• Manage and ensure the functionality of key systems used by the Finance team (Coupa, Sage Intacct, Tableau, etc.).
• Develop reports and dashboards in Tableau that answer business operation questions submitted by leadership.
• Regularly review and identify insights from financial data stored in various forms (SQL tables, analytics tools, spreadsheets, etc.).
• Communicate insights and recommendations in a clear, succinct, and action-oriented format.
• Develop new, reinvent existing, add features to, and optimize data structure for new and existing data analytics in Tableau.
• Provide internal technical support and act as the main point of contact for external contact support.
• Develop and train the team on process improvement initiatives to drive efficiency Properly document system processes and procedures to ensure successful knowledge transfer.

Skills Needed to Succeed
• SQL, Python, Tableau or other related programming language and data visualization skills and experience.
• Insatiable curiosity.
• Strong statistical, analytical, and reasoning skills.
• Excellent verbal, written, and interpersonal communication skills to maintain relationships and partnerships.
• Ability to self-motivate, take initiative, make independent decisions, and problem-solve.
• Ability to collaborate in a team environment and work independently.
• Bachelor’s degree in related field.
• 1-3 years of related work experience.

Benefits We Offer
• Paid parental leave, including maternity, paternity, and adoption leave.
• Generous employer-paid leave for the use of vacation, sick time, and other qualifying reasons.
• Innovative and comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision insurance that provides team members with useful resources and savings to navigate their holistic health.
• Life insurance policy provided for all staff members at 2x annual salary at no cost. Additional life insurance coverage is available to purchase.
• Short-Term and Long-Term disability covered at 100% for full-time qualified staff members.
• Comprehensive wellness and mental health benefits allow staff to proactively invest in their physical and emotional health.
• Generous 401(k) retirement plan allowing a team member to have up to 12.5% (including employee contribution, employer match, and employer discretionary contribution) contributed into their account in their first year. It doesn’t stop there—the more years on staff, the greater the investment!
• $160 annually in development dollars for team members to invest in their professional growth.
• Casual dress and work environment.
• Flexible work schedule.
• And much more!

Our Beliefs, Culture, and Commitment to Diversity
At Life.Church, every staff member, and intern is a minister and is expected to engage in the church's ministry fully. We consider ministry readiness and an individual’s capacity to represent Life.Church’s beliefs as a minister during the selection process for all staff and intern positions. An essential function within every position held by a staff member or intern at Life.Church is to uphold and represent the beliefs of Life.Church. Learn more about what we believe at Life.Church.

While we unite around our mission, we know unity doesn’t mean uniformity. Our calling is too great, and our mission is too important not to be intentional about strengthening our team through diversity. We know that diverse perspectives in race, ethnicity, background, age, and gender are essential to reaching the world for Christ. To learn more about how we strengthen our team through diversity, visit our careers page.

All data collected in our application process, from resume collection to application questions, is used for recruitment purposes only.

data.job_description:
Data Analyst / Bioinformatics Specialist

Overview
OMRF is an independent, not-for-profit biomedical research institute adjacent to the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center (OUHSC) campus in Oklahoma City. Oklahoma City offers a dynamic and flourishing downtown area, with low cost of living, short commute times and a diversified economy.

OMRF's excellence can only be fully realized by individuals who share our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. Successful candidates will demonstrate commitment to these values. OMRF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

Benefits

We offer competitive salaries and comprehensive benefits including, medical, dental, and vision insurance, minimum 8% company retirement contribution, vacation and sick leave, paid holidays, onsite cafe, free onsite fitness center with access to personal trainer, free parking and much more! Relocation assistance available for those located 50 miles outside of Oklahoma City metro and out of state. Learn more about our benefits here.

Responsibilities
The Nath laboratory is seeking a highly motivated, self-starter senior level scientist with the ability to work with optimal resources and little direct supervision to address important questions in the genetics and genomics of systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE or lupus), an autoimmune disease. Using large-scale genome wise association studies (GWAS), our lab has identified several genes/genetic variants associated with lupus susceptibility. Now we are trying to understand the specific functional effects of those lupus associated genetic variants, using cell lines from patient-derived primary immune cells or tissues. We will apply various modern techniques for studying features of three-dimensional (3D) genomic organization such as 3C, Hi-C, ChIP-Seq, RNA-seq and genome editing using CRISPR/Cas9 based techniques. Successful candidate will be proficient in a wide range of analytical methods and the use of bioinformatics/genetics software for analyzing and interpreting various types of data.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Computer Science, Genetics, Epidemiology, computational sciences or relevant field or a combination of relevant experience and education. Must have knowledge and experience of statistical genetic methods for gene-mapping for complex traits, and computer programming skills (e.g. familiarity with UNIX-like OS, and at least one programming language) are required.

To apply, visit https://careers-omrf.icims.com/jobs/1034/data-analyst/job?in_iframe=1

OMRF’s excellence can only be fully realized by individuals who share our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. Successful candidates will demonstrate commitment to these values. OMRF is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, color, national origin, age, religion, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected characteristic.

data.job_description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Regulated Compliance Data Analyst (Crop Science R&D)

YOUR TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES

The primary responsibilities of this role, Regulated Compliance Data Analyst (Crop Science R&D), are to:

\tAcquire data from primary or secondary data sources (single or multiple systems); \tDevelop and implement queries/databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality; \tManage and design the reporting environment, including data sources, security, and metadata; \tSupport the data warehouse in identifying and revising reporting requirements; \tSupport initiatives for data integrity and normalization; \tProvide technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing; \tIdentify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets; \tFilter and perform quality assurance of data by reviewing reports/outputs, and key performance indicators to locate and correct code problems; \tManage access of data for users and user roles; \tTrain end-users on new reports and dashboards; \tWork with management to prioritize business and information needs; \tLocate and define new process improvement opportunities; \tContribute to the implementation of the corporate data stewardship strategy.

WHO YOU ARE

Your success will be driven by your demonstration of our LIFE (Leadership Integrity Flexibility Efficiency) values. More specifically related to this position, Bayer seeks an incumbent who possesses the following:

Required Qualifications:

\tMinimum of Bachelor’s degree; \tTwo or more years of working experience as a Data Analyst, Business Data Analyst or similar role; \tStrong experience in data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques; \tStrong knowledge of and experience with reporting and visualization packages; \tKnowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets; \tStrong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy; \tAbility to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms; \tAdept at queries, report writing and presenting findings.

Preferred Qualifications:

\tDegree in Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Management, Statistics and/or closely related field; \tExperience utilizing reporting and visualization packages such as Microsoft Power BI, Tableau and/or Spotfire; \tExperience accessing data from databases such as SQL or similar; \tExperience programming with XML, JavaScript, and/or ETL frameworks; \tExperience utilizing Excel, SPSS, SAS, and/or similar software for statistical analysis; \tExperience in driving business process towards new digital solutions; \tProactive, highly motivated, and flexible with the ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment; \tTrack record of demonstrating innovation and creativity; \tStrong analytical and problem-solving skills.

Visa Sponsorship may be available for this role.

Position will be based in Chesterfield, Missouri.

Position may include opportunity to work up to 90% remote.

data.job_description: As an associate manager of data analysis on the Progressive Home Direct Analyst team, you’ll lead a team of two analysts and ensure that results align with objectives for all property products in the direct channel. You’ll develop Cost Benefit Analysis and Key Performance Indicators for changes in quoting systems and identify opportunities to minimize uprates and Underwriting cancels. Additionally, you’ll provide actionable insights to product managers by completing segmentation and profitability analysis of our customer base as well as indicating the impacts of competitive advantage or disadvantage. Remote work allowed. Must-have qualifications - Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitative field such as Finance, Mathematics, Accounting, Economics or Statistics or other related fields of study and a minimum of three years prior analyst experience. - In lieu of a degree, a minimum of eight years analyst experience. Preferred Skills - Property and/or direct quoting experience - Ability to leverage data to inform strategic decisions - Ability to develop and present insights via reports and dashboards - Ability to build and leverage cross-functional relationships - Experience managing or mentoring people Compensation - $82,400 - $109,900/year - Gainshare bonus up to 30% of your eligible earnings based on company performance Benefits - 401(k) with dollar-for-dollar company match up to 6% - Medical, dental & vision, including free preventative care - Wellness & mental health programs - Health care flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, & life insurance - Paid time off - Paid & unpaid sick leave where applicable, as well as short & long-term disability - Parental & family leave; military leave & pay - Diverse, inclusive & welcoming culture with Employee Resource Groups - Career development & tuition assistance Equal Opportunity Employer Sponsorship for work authorization for foreign national candidates is not available for this position #LI-Remote

Panasonic – Data Analyst Intern

Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.

Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.

Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us.

What You'll Get to Do:

Reporting and Communication:
• Create visualizations, dashboards, and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
• Provide insights to team members to help inform business decisions

Data Collection and Preparation:
• Assist with collecting and cleaning large data sets from various sources
• Organize and maintain databases, ensuring accuracy and consistency
• Collaborate with team members to identify relevant data sources and extract information

Data Analysis:
• Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights
• Help develop and maintain statistical models and predictive analytics
• Continuously monitor data quality and provide recommendations for improvement

Company Information Legend Biotech is a global biotechnology company dedicated to treating, and one day curing, life-threatening diseases. Headquartered in Somerset, New Jersey, we are developing advanced cell therapies across a diverse array of technology platforms, including autologous and allogenic chimeric antigen receptor T-cell and natural killer (NK) cell-based immunotherapy. Legend Biotech entered into a global collaboration agreement with Janssen, one of the pharmaceutical companies of Johnson & Johnson, to jointly develop and commercialize ciltacabtagene autolecuel (cilta-cel) in 2017. Our strategic partnership is designed to combine the strengths and expertise of both companies to advance the promise of an immunotherapy in the treatment of multiple myeloma. Legend Biotech is seeking CMC Process Data Analyst as part of the Technical Operations team based in Raritan, NJ. Role Overview This role functions to support and ensure data integrity for the electronic data management systems encompassing a broad range of data streams associated with CAR-T development and manufacture. The preferred candidate will have demonstrated experience in GMP manufacturing and data management (prior experience with CAR-T products preferred) with appropriate statistical analysis capabilities. Key Responsibilities Work with paper and electronic systems MES, SAP, LIMS, Anaplan, eLN, etc. to aggregate and verify data for manufacturing performance tracking and trending. Responsible for development of routine reports with verified data. Participate in the design and maintenance of tools, workflows, systems, and policy to maintain data quality for the integration of data from multiple sources. Support investigations to provide manufacturing data for deviation investigation and support with data analysis and visualization as required. Provide support for Technical Operations group with data support including data analysis assistance and data integrity review of trend investigations, process improvement study reports, regulatory responses, and Continuing Process Validation. Support Manufacturing Dashboard activities including updating, maintaining and creation of new visualizations. Conduct impact assessments for process and batch record change controls to assess impact on data collection strategy and physical or coding impact on data management and visualization tools. Assist with activities for mapping data from data lake (consolidated data from MES, SAP, eLIMS, etc) for use in reporting and analysis. Requirements A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in biology, science, engineering, mathematics/computer science, or related field or equivalent experience required. Advanced degree preferred. A minimum of 1-3 years of experience within a cGMP environment in the biotech/biopharma industry. Cell/Gene Therapy cGMP manufacturing experience preferred. Strong statistical analysis capability. Ability to work with paper and electronic system for data compilation including MES, SAP, LIMS, etc. Technical CAR-T knowledge or Biotech process knowledge preferred. An ability to build strong partnerships and effectively integrate with external collaborators to drive projects/programs forward in a matrixed environment. Build strong partnerships with Manufacturing, Engineering and Quality to ensure seamless execution of daily production schedules. Strong analytical, problem solving and critical thinking skills and the ability to lead as a change agent to promote efficiency and accountability. Strong attention to detail and drive for quality work. Clear and succinct verbal and written communication skills. #LI-TY1 #Li-HybridLegend Biotech is a proud equal opportunity/affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Legend's policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Legend Biotech maintains a drug-free workplace.
Salary: . Date posted: 01/19/2023

data.job_description:
Data Analyst

The Opportunity:
For an organization to transform in today’s digital world, it needs to properly collect, store, and organize its data. Effective data management can enable more efficient operations, yielding more growth. As a Data Analyst professional, you know how to apply your creative-thinking and analytical mindset to help organizations manage their data assets. We’re looking for an experienced data architect like you to deliver leading-edge solutions for national security and defense. As a Data Analyst on our Defense Cyber Risk Management team, you’ll use your technical expertise to design data architecture solutions for how the DoD should catalog and mitigate cyber vulnerabilities to weapon systems and defense critical infrastructure. You’ll resolve routine data architecture issues in collaboration with business analysts and technology teams by obtaining and maintaining an organizations’ data elements and identifying attributes. You will also create data storage, retrieve, troubleshoot, and implement recovery processes of the data for the purpose of visualization in a cloud environment.

In this role, you’ll apply best practices and tools, including Databricks, Qlik, Tableau, MS Power BI, Enterprise Architect, and Visio to oversee the ingestions of multiple databases and organize data elements to be utilized in providing senior leaders situational awareness of operations and capabilities. You’ll grow your technical experience as you assist in the design, definition, development, and testing of cloud solution components, serving as a liaison between clients and developers to ensure that requirements are met and solutions are delivered. With your drive to establish processes and support technological innovation, you’ll make a lasting impact on National Security.

Join us. The world can’t wait.

You Have:  
• 3+ years of experience with Data Science, including Databricks, Tableau, Power BI, or Qlik
• Experience with data management, programming, big data developments, systems analysis, and technology architectures
• Knowledge of industry functions, including how data is collected, analyzed, and utilized
• Knowledge of modifying and building user interfaces
• Ability to research new opportunities for data acquisition
• Ability to communicate with government clients, contractors, and mission partners to provide shared understanding of complex data analysis to meet contractual obligations
• Ability to identify and evaluate data management technologies
• Ability to implement measures to ensure data accuracy and accessibility
• TS/SCI clearance
• Bachelor's degree

Nice If You Have:  
• Experience in Cybersecurity or Cybersecurity certifications
• Experience working with OSD, Headquarters level organizations in the DoD
• Experience in AI and ML such as Natural Language Processing (NLP) or other advanced capabilities
• Ability to program in Python, Java, and R
• Possession of excellent analytical problem-solving skills, including employing the right approach and methods to maximize use of time and human resources
• Certified Data Management Professional

Clearance:  
Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information; TS/SCI clearance is required.

Create Your Career:
Grow With Us
Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

A Place Where You Belong
Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

Support Your Well-Being
Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

Your Candidate Journey
At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

Compensation

At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.

Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $58,400.00 to $133,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees.

Work Model
Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.
• If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
• If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

EEO Commitment

We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

data.job_description:
Title: Data Visualization Engineer - SQL, Tableau, Qlik (SQL programming, R)
Location: Remote
Salary: $110-115K
Must be a US Citizen and have ability to obtain Secret Clearance

Our Visualizations team is seeking a REMOTE Visualizations Developer to support our customer's established portfolio of data visualizations and ever-growing development requirements. The ideal candidate will have proven experience with, and a solid understanding of, modern data visualization tools for promoting data-driven decision making and promoting business process improvement. The ideal candidate will submit qualified experience and portfolio examples prior to any consideration, be able to perform the following duties, and possess the supporting education and employment experience:

Responsibilities to include but not limited to-
• High proficiency in data visualizations and dashboard development using visualization tools (to include Tableau, Power BI, Qlik, etc.)
• Develop visualization products to customer’s requirements, generally through iterative development meetings, with strict adherence to data fidelity while delivering creative, appealing and interactive dashboards.
• Deliver professionally designed visualizations that adhere to established internal design standards, while continually seeking ways to better or improve upon established standards with alignment to the team’s mission and growing requirements.
• Support internal and external customers, including direct team members, with sound understanding of data concepts, data management, visualizations development processes, and the like, though robust collaboration and fostering data stewardship.
• Database experience, preferably through SQL utilization, to execute on data mining, data queries, and data cleansing for the purposes of ad hoc queries and data modeling that support development of front-end visualizations products.
• Quality assurance adherence through iterative peer and subject matter expert reviews, with the ability to independently validate resultant work output against qualified data.
• Troubleshoot and problem solve defects in visualization design, level of detail expressions, complex queries, views, stored procedures etc., to improve data quality and optimization for the most accurate and performant dashboards.
• Excellent communications skills, strong analytical skills, punctual, and the ability to work independently and as part of a team, especially within a virtual environment.
• Self-motivated, detail-oriented, ability to manage multiple requirements, and the agility to support changing/emergent priorities as set-forth by government customer.

Required Education:
• BA/BS degree in data science, accounting, statistics, mathematics, computer science, business, or related field; ALLOWABLE SUBSTITUION: Two (2) years of additional experience may be substituted for a bachelor's degree.

Required Experience:
• Minimum of 3 years of related analytical experience
• Direct work experience utilizing current industry accepted analytical tools equivalent to Tableau and/or Power BI
• Experience with agile development through multiple development environments and utilizing software development management tools such as Azure DevOps
• Experience developing using Microsoft SQL Server or other database tools
• Full-stack visualizations developer (SQL to Tableau)
• Providing support and product development to a large community of visualizations end-users (10k+)
• This position is FULLY REMOTE. Must be available to work during standard business hours in the Eastern Time Zone, regardless of geographic location
• Ability to work in a virtual environment: Interface continuously throughout the day with team members, leadership, and customers via various web platform(s)
• Professional certifications desired (list not exhaustive) - Tableau Certified Data Analyst, Tableau Desktop Specialist, Tableau Server Associate, MCSA: SQL 2016 BI Development, MCSA: Azure Data Scientist Associate, Microsoft Power BI Data Analyst, MCSA: BI Reporting.

Qualifications: Must be a US Citizen and have ability to obtain Secret Clearance

The ideal candidate will have proven experience with, and a solid understanding of, modern data visualization tools for promoting data-driven decision making and promoting business process improvement

The ideal candidate will submit qualified experience and portfolio examples prior to any consideration, be able to perform the following duties, and possess the supporting education and employment experience:

Self-motivated, detail-oriented, ability to manage multiple requirements, and the agility to support changing/emergent priorities as set-forth by government customer
